Classify version of NUTS codes

Source: R/classify_nuts.R
classify_nuts.Rd

classify_nuts() can identify the NUTS version year and level from a variable containing NUTS codes

Usage

classify_nuts(
  data = data,
  nuts_code = nuts_code,
  group_vars = NULL,
  ties = "most_recent"
)

Arguments

data

A data frame or tibble that contains a variable with NUTS 1, 2 or 3 codes and possibly other variables. NUTS codes must be of the same level and need to be unique, unless additional grouping variables are specified. No duplicate NUTS codes within groups allowed.

nuts_code

Variable name containing NUTS codes

group_vars

Variable name(s) for classification within groups. Always computes overlap within country. NULLby default.

ties

Picks 'most_recent' or 'oldest' version when overlap is identical across multiple NUTS versions. 'most_recent' by default.

Value

A list of three tibbles. The first tibble contains the original data with the classified NUTS version, level, and country. The second tibble lists the group-specific overlap with each NUTS version. The third tibble shows missing NUTS codes for each group.

The output can be passed to convert_nuts_version() to convert data across NUTS versions and convert_nuts_level() to aggregate across NUTS levels.

Examples

library(dplyr)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘dplyr’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:stats’:
#> 
#>     filter, lag
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:base’:
#> 
#>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

# Load EUROSTAT data of manure storage deposits
data(manure)

# Data varies at the NUTS level x indicator x year x country x NUTS code level
head(manure)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 4
#>   indic_ag   geo    time values
#>   <chr>      <chr> <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 I07A1_EQ_Y AT     2010  97401
#> 2 I07A1_EQ_Y AT1    2010  21388
#> 3 I07A1_EQ_Y AT11   2010   2110
#> 4 I07A1_EQ_Y AT111  2010    270
#> 5 I07A1_EQ_Y AT112  2010    455
#> 6 I07A1_EQ_Y AT113  2010   1385

# Classify version of NUTS 2 codes in Germany
manure %>%
 filter(nchar(geo) == 4) %>%
 filter(indic_ag == 'I07A_EQ_Y') %>%
 filter(grepl('^DE', geo)) %>%
 filter(time == 2003) %>%
 select(-indic_ag, -time) %>%
 # Data varies at the NUTS code level
 classify_nuts(nuts_code = 'geo')
#> $data
#> # A tibble: 36 × 5
#>    from_code from_version from_level country values
#>    <chr>     <chr>             <dbl> <chr>    <dbl>
#>  1 DE11      2006                  2 Germany  11320
#>  2 DE12      2006                  2 Germany   3710
#>  3 DE13      2006                  2 Germany   9710
#>  4 DE14      2006                  2 Germany  11220
#>  5 DE21      2006                  2 Germany  22760
#>  6 DE22      2006                  2 Germany  16390
#>  7 DE23      2006                  2 Germany  12500
#>  8 DE24      2006                  2 Germany   8440
#>  9 DE25      2006                  2 Germany  10380
#> 10 DE26      2006                  2 Germany   6150
#> # ℹ 26 more rows
#> 
#> $versions_data
#> # A tibble: 6 × 3
#> # Groups:   country [2]
#>   from_version country overlap_perc
#>   <chr>        <chr>          <dbl>
#> 1 2006         Germany        100  
#> 2 2021         Germany         88.6
#> 3 2016         Germany         88.6
#> 4 2013         Germany         88.6
#> 5 2010         Germany         88.6
#> 6 NA           NA              NA  
#> 
#> $missing_data
#> # A tibble: 4 × 4
#> # Groups:   from_version, country [1]
#>   from_code from_version from_level country
#>   <chr>     <chr>             <dbl> <chr>  
#> 1 DE30      2006                  2 Germany
#> 2 DE50      2006                  2 Germany
#> 3 DE60      2006                  2 Germany
#> 4 DEC0      2006                  2 Germany
#> 
#> attr(,"groups")
#> [1] "country"
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "nuts.classified" "list"           

# Classify version of NUTS 3 codes within country and year
manure %>%
  filter(nchar(geo) == 5) %>%
  filter(indic_ag == 'I07A_EQ_Y') %>%
  select(-indic_ag) %>%
  # Data varies at the year x country x NUTS code level. The country grouping
  # is always used by default.
  classify_nuts(nuts_code = 'geo', group_vars = 'time')
#> $data
#> # A tibble: 1,902 × 6
#>    from_code from_version from_level country  time values
#>    <chr>     <chr>             <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>  <dbl>
#>  1 AT111     2021                  3 Austria  2010    276
#>  2 AT112     2021                  3 Austria  2010    482
#>  3 AT113     2021                  3 Austria  2010   1422
#>  4 AT121     2021                  3 Austria  2010   6889
#>  5 AT122     2021                  3 Austria  2010   3133
#>  6 AT123     2021                  3 Austria  2010   2027
#>  7 AT124     2021                  3 Austria  2010   5870
#>  8 AT125     2021                  3 Austria  2010    905
#>  9 AT126     2021                  3 Austria  2010   1103
#> 10 AT127     2021                  3 Austria  2010    506
#> # ℹ 1,892 more rows
#> 
#> $versions_data
#> # A tibble: 312 × 4
#> # Groups:   country, time [67]
#>    from_version country  time overlap_perc
#>    <chr>        <chr>   <dbl>        <dbl>
#>  1 2021         Austria  2010        100  
#>  2 2016         Austria  2010        100  
#>  3 2013         Austria  2010        100  
#>  4 2010         Austria  2010        100  
#>  5 2006         Austria  2010        100  
#>  6 2016         Belgium  2000        100  
#>  7 2013         Belgium  2000        100  
#>  8 2010         Belgium  2000        100  
#>  9 2006         Belgium  2000        100  
#> 10 2021         Belgium  2000         81.8
#> # ℹ 302 more rows
#> 
#> $missing_data
#> # A tibble: 324 × 5
#> # Groups:   from_version, country, time [16]
#>    from_code from_version from_level country  time
#>    <chr>     <chr>             <dbl> <chr>   <dbl>
#>  1 CZ010     2021                  3 Czechia  2003
#>  2 DK011     2021                  3 Denmark  2003
#>  3 DK012     2021                  3 Denmark  2003
#>  4 EE001     2016                  3 Estonia  2003
#>  5 EE007     2016                  3 Estonia  2003
#>  6 EL111     2010                  3 Greece   2003
#>  7 EL112     2010                  3 Greece   2003
#>  8 EL113     2010                  3 Greece   2003

#> 10 EL115     2010                  3 Greece   2003
